meanings.definition: A person or thing that presses.
meanings.sent1: The pressers at the factory work hard to flatten the clothes.
meanings.sent2: The laundry pressers quickly ironed all the shirts.
meanings.sent3: The little pressers in the toy set made sure all the play-dough shapes were perfect.
meanings.sent4: The pressers of the printing machine hummed in harmony, creating newspapers.
meanings.sent5: The heavy pressers in the workshop made a loud noise as they stamped the metal sheets.

meanings.sent1: The pressers in the room were all busy with their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The pressers gathered around the table to discuss the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The pressers on the team cheered loudly after winning the game.
meanings.sent4: The pressers of the buttons on the elevator were worn out from constant use.
meanings.sent5: The pressers of the keys on the piano played a beautiful melody together.

meanings.sent1: She is pressers the clothes before hanging them to dry.
meanings.sent2: The machine pressers the metal into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent3: The cat pressers its paws against the window to get attention.
meanings.sent4: Time pressers on, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The crowd pressers forward to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.
